Episodes.Title: San Diego
Episodes.Plot: James and Martin set out to make a quintessential Southern California brew by using ingredients they harvest themselves, including kelp and the world?s hottest chili -- brewed while traveling 70mph on a train up the Pacific coast.

Episodes.Title: San Francisco
Episodes.Plot: The BREW DOGS get ?foggy? in San Fran by making the world?s first vaporized beer. You don?t drink this beer, you inhale it!

Episodes.Title: Philadelphia
Episodes.Plot: James and Martin make The Most American Beer Ever Brewed. It?s brewed on a float during a Fourth of July parade -- and the final ingredient is added as fireworks light up the Philadelphia sky.

Episodes.Title: Seattle
Episodes.Plot: James and Martin brew the world?s most-caffeinated beer -- a big, bold, chocolate-coffee imperial stout -- on the top deck of the Bainbridge Island Ferry.

Episodes.Title: Denver
Episodes.Plot: The guys brew the ultimate Western beer -- a solar-powered, cactus-infused, meat pale ale -- at 14,000 feet, using only the sun?s rays to boil the brew.

Episodes.Title: Portland
Episodes.Plot: The BREW DOGS create a uniquely Oregonian beer -- a fresh-hopped, blackberry-infused Berlinerweisse -- while floating on a beer-keg raft down the Willamette River.

Episodes.Title: Boston
Episodes.Plot: Along with Sam Adams? proprietor and legendary craft beer entrepreneur Jim Koch, Martin and James brew a Boston Clambake beer, infused with lobsters and clams and brewed on a tall ship sailing through Boston Harbor.
